result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dale R Rapey

records.addlTxt:
Prosecuting Attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Brian Michael Borkowicz in court for Dale R. Rapey.  Defendant is appearing on Zoom video but is sleeping.  Case passed to allow Atty. Borkorwicz to call defendant.  Case recalled.  Defendant appears via audio.
Hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Zoom appearance granted for 10/19/22 at 9:45 a.m.
Motion and Demand for Discovery & Inspection

Prosecuting Attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appears via video in custody from the Washington County Jail and by Atty. Gordon Leech.  Court has colloquy with Defendant regarding right to be physically present at today's hearing and accepts consent to use of video conferencing. Counsel requests an adjournment to accommodate defendant's medical situation.  No objection from the State.  Resolution anticipated.
Hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Dale R Rapey in court.  Attorney Gordon R Leech in court for Dale R Rapey. Information rec'd and reading waived, not guilty plea entered.
Hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Prosecuting attorney Stephanie L Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Dale R Rapey in court.  Attorney Gordon R Leech in court for Dale R Rapey. Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial and State shall file an Information. Court reviews motion for bail modification; State objects to modification.  Court denies motion. Copy of information received and reading waived, not guilty plea entered; State to electronically file the information. 
Hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bond Conditions

Prosecuting Attorney Stephanie L. Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Dale R. Rapey in court and by Attorney Gordon R. Leech.  Counsel's first appearance.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 09:15 am.

records.addlTxt: Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. Not possess any firearms or ammunition. Not consume any alcohol.

Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Dale R Rapey in court, in custody.  Attorney Wilfred P. de Junco in court for Dale R Rapey. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Argument on bond.  Court sets $500 sig bond. Preliminary hearing time limits waived.   Defendant eligible for State Public Defender. Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney and for position on preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 10:15 am.
